annotations.summary: Patient reports right knee pain for six weeks limiting stair climbing.
Gradual onset from recreational basketball, no specific injury.
Pain localized to medial knee and under kneecap, worse with bending.
Post-exercise swelling that resolves by next day.
Knee buckling episodes and audible popping or clicking.
Baseline pain 4/10, increases to 7-8 after basketball.
Self-treating with ice, ibuprofen, and knee brace.
Age 38, father had knee replacement at 60 for arthritis.
210 lbs at 5'10, gained 20 pounds over two years.
